documents.document: (I have been waiting a long time to use that carefully prepared gif)
Turnbull: "When I need to ... give frank advice, fearless advice to the United States government, I do so privately."
Turmbull says @JoeHockey has just phoned him to say he's had assurances from the White House that Aust dual nationals can still travel to US
Turnbull says he's committed to RET as "restructured under my predecessor" (ie Abbott)
Turnbull says he didn't discuss the TPP with Trump yesterday
Asked if he finds Trump immigration order discriminatory, Turnbull says, "Our rules, or laws, our values are very well known."
Turnbull says DFAT so far not been asked for help from any Australians affected by the Trump executive order on immigration.
US officials have already been on Nauru screening people. Turnbull says acceptance of any into US refugee program is a matter for the US.
Turnbull won't give any more details of that resettlement deal
PM: We also discussed the resettlement arrangement of refugees from Nauru & Manus...and I thank Pres Trump for his commitment to honour that
Turnbull says in "constructive" conversation he and Trump recommitted to already strong and deep relationship between Aust and US.
Turnbull talking about the phone call he had with Trump at ~9am AEDT yesterday
Re Aust's refugee deal with US, Morrison says both Trump and Turnbull are business men who know "a deal's a deal"
Update to my last RT https://t.co/9I3eBvVR4B
Anti-council amalgamation protesters crowd behind Berejiklian as she announces new ministry https://t.co/FOOPhYztRJ
Grab bag of protesters in Queanbeyan for @GladysB cabinet announcement - Gonski, council mergers, against a local ring road
White House pool reporters have seen Trump on the phone to Turnbull, with chief strategist Bannon and national security adviser Flynn.
Di Natale predicts Trump is leading the US towards "economic ruination". Says if 20% tariff was One Nation policy, "they would be lampooned"
Vegemite Frugii verdict: vegemitey, but not too overpowering. Saltier than most salted caramel flavours. @osbornep https://t.co/9tnCNsxwsP
Rod Culleton's chief of staff is spending #AustraliaDay clearing out his parly office - story from AAP's @osbornep https://t.co/MFrQMuyEcf
I've had the delight of performing several of Sitsky's playful works, including for him, and I'm so pleased he's be… https://t.co/h4Y3KfqvJo
@katedoak Not that I heard
Except for that same-sex marriage plebiscite bill...
Turnbull: "It's not my practice to introduce legislation into the parliament that isn't going to be passed."
Turnbull says govt will decide whether to push on w/ legislation to ratify TPP based on discussions with other countries and if it will pass
Turnbull says he's confident the US deal on refugees will be maintained. "We're in extensive discussions with the Trump administration."
PM: There are many bigger and more profound issues, incl constitutional recognition, to deal with than changing the date of #AustraliaDay
Turnbull says we should keep Jan 26 as #AustraliaDay. "It's a day where we celebrate the rich diversity of all our cultures."
@stephanieando They were wearing matching aprons earlier too!
New citizen Janet Collins came to Aust in 1966, stayed four years and returned to UK. Says she's back now because of Brexit!
@workmanalice Do you think they mean unintelligible?
Turnbull opened his #AustraliaDay remarks rhapsodising about hearing gunfire in the nation's capital... https://t.co/RPhQ81SA0G
@OldCroaky Thanks! It is the manifestation of my beginner crochet practice.
@OldCroaky It's ok. I don't have the most refined coffee palate though.
PSA: Queen's Terrace Cafe at parliament now serving Lonsdale Street Roasters coffee https://t.co/G0bMyHCG6M
@karenlsweeney I'm feeling grateful I got a five-year media visa last year
Means if you want to holiday or attend conference in the US you'd have to go to Syd, Melb or Perth for a visa first… https://t.co/HBCQmOAuhL
Morrison says the govt "continues to believe trade is an important part of an Australia first policy"
@workmanalice @channelten When I used it to watch The Wrong Girl it showed me an ad for the next ep with spoilers for the one I was watching
@GilmoreGuysShow in ep2 where M dances solo - she's doing choreog she gave girls in ep1 fake audition. Auditioning for new life in Paradise?
ADowner says UK has asked lots of qs about the TPP - but notes w/ them not being a trans-Pacific country they have a geographic disadvantage
Grief from miscarriage is too often silent. Thanks to the women who shared their stories with me (via @AAPNewswire) https://t.co/QnyLzZnLng
Shorten says he believes cyber safety is a legitimate issue, but "I have to say to Malcolm Turnbull ... not everything is a political game."
Shorten says he worked better with Abbott on issues of national security than with Turnbull.
@Rashidajourno @MarkDiStef How is the area of Sydney defined?
Turnbull: "I am not aware of evidence in recent times that a foreign country has sought to influence an Australian election"
Turnbull: "It is possible that US policy could change over time on this [TPP]." (um, Trump signed an executive order to withdraw)
Turnbull says biggest vulnerabilities are often in "warmware" - human users making mistakes or stealing info
Turnbull says govt will make sure all political parties and leaders are aware of the risks of cyber attacks and how to protect themselves.
Turnbull (in front of a hedge, and zero flags) says the cyber sphere is the new frontier of warfare
Ticket to Sydney test from Westpac https://t.co/X6QqNXZW6X
Tickets to Sydney test from Cricket Australia https://t.co/o5gJnUZMBT
Got a Harrods hamper from investment group Pacific Century Group, which he donated to ACT Palliative Care https://t.co/yoHEJmJ7Bv
Joined the CFMEU https://t.co/gVzRUG6UXF
Christmas hamper https://t.co/c1OZ68ZgWD
He got a caravan and camping themed Monopoly game from the Caravan industry Association of Australia https://t.co/YolC6m5HV3
Missing @tveedercom dearly this morning
Asked if govt will still put legislation to ratify TPP to parliament ASAP, Ciobo says they will "keep that option alive".
Ciobo says he hasn't got any modelling on what TPP would be worth to Australia without the US being part of it.
Just in case the TPP acronym wasn't already inscrutable enough...
Ciobo says he's been talking to other trade partners about a TPP12-1 (ie, Trans-Pacific Partnership without the US)
Trump kills TPP with a pen flourish and a smile (via @AAPNewswire) https://t.co/Bm8ospML48
Come on, people! (She was also asked what she does in her "spare time" and what movies she likes) https://t.co/6NnMg3fd0t
@Rashidajourno What about Annastacia Palaszczuk?
Asked why Aust needs to ratify TPP when it's not going to happen, Joyce says because it's a clear indicator of our intentions on trade.
Luke Foley says Mike Baird is "no greyhound - he pulled up halfway through the race".
What story does Turnbull want to read the nation at bedtime? @adamgartrell wonders https://t.co/YwhicR9JfR
Shorten says Baird was "a very talented state Liberal in NSW, probably their best".
Turnbull has spoken to Baird and thanked him for "remarkable leadership getting NSW moving again" and building infrastructure.
Says he wants to give new leadership time to settle in before March 2019 election https://t.co/lzp57pPtXR
Hunt's first presser as health minister is at Frankston Hospital, where his mother worked, parents met, and father had end-of-life care
A reminder of the humans behind regime change https://t.co/5NPqgIGx19
New health and sport minister Greg Hunt says he's son and husband to nurses, plus "a sports fan and sports Dad" https://t.co/aIFYXPhLMA
PM says MPs are fiduciaries of taxpayer cash. "We have to spend every dollar of taxpayers money with even more care than we spend our own."
Turnbull asked if new health minister Hunt will be able to base himself in Noosa or Hayman Island on taxpayer dime. Half laughs at question.
@workmanalice @BuzzFeedBen What is its etymology?
PM is holding his press conference in Sydney at 10.15am (expected to be the ministry reshuffle news)
Chester: "We don't want to provide false hope to the families and friends." #MH370
Chester says he wouldn't rule out a new underwater search if there is credible new info about location of MH370.
Chester: "No one is coming to me ... and saying 'We know where MH370 is'." Says new info was *if* search extended, this is where to target.
Chester re MH370: "It is with a great deal of frustration and disappointment I stand here and acknowledge the search has been suspended"
Turnbull now giving a lesson in email password security...
Turnbull said he won't lose a moment's sleep over any One Nation MP heading to Trump's inauguration.
Turnbull says Ambassador to US Joe Hockey is doing a very good job engaging with the incoming Trump administration
Asked about his not going to Trump's inauguration, Turnbull says it's "very much a domestic event" and foreign leaders not usually invited.
I suspect the power of reading as both an escape and an (ongoing) education is too often underused https://t.co/RXAJaAQlw6
@jmodoh What was the tattoo of?
Hanson says "only 20,000 tickets have been issued" to inauguration, but NBC says congress members got 250,000 tix https://t.co/cL2umyXLup
Hanson says she got the tix to Trump's inauguration from a congressman but won't reveal which one. https://t.co/T4y86dmI7g
@heldavidson I have had cause to consult my copy of the constitution several times during his term, so I guess that's accurate
Press release from Culleton reads a lot like a valedictory statement. Says he's proud of what he's achieved while d… https://t.co/hxZEf0tCYS
Shorten also wants the Senate committee looking at anti-corruption regime in federal politics to be reconstituted.
Shorten indicates Labor could bring its own expenses reform bill if govt doesn't have theirs ready to go when parliament comes back.
Ashby insists it is "pure speculation" that he wants to run for a Queensland state seat (via @AAPNewswire) https://t.co/1RWd56ZU6e
@MarkDiStef Somewhere in parly anyway
@MarkDiStef Caucus room pics are on white backgrounds
@MarkDiStef Wait, no, the coalition party room photos are mounted on black card. As you were. https://t.co/oLDqzKO5iV
@MarkDiStef But maybe they just have the same frames on their photos at the UN
@MarkDiStef That pic of her "shar[ing] a magical moment after PM's presentation in UN Assembly" looks a lot like it's the APH Lib party room
